templates.name: question_hook
templates.description: Opens with an engaging question to draw the reader in
templates.skeleton:
[Question about user's goal/challenge]?

[Product name] [provides/offers] [core value proposition]. [Feature 1], [feature 2], and [feature 3] [are designed to/help you] [achieve outcome].

[Brief benefit statement]. [CTA sentence].
openers: Looking for a better way to {goal}?
Wondering how to {achieve outcome}?
Ready to take your {activity} to the next level?
Want access to {valuable resource}?
Searching for {solution type}?
closings: Check it out and see what works for your situation.
Explore the options and find your fit.
Take a look at what's available.
See if it matches what you need.

templates.name: problem_solution
templates.description: Identifies a pain point then presents the solution
templates.skeleton:
[Problem statement about common challenge]. [Acknowledgment of difficulty].

[Product name] [addresses/tackles/solves] this by [solution approach]. [Feature details]. [How it helps].

[Outcome users can expect]. [Qualifier about results].
openers: Finding reliable {resource type} can be challenging.
Getting started with {activity} often feels overwhelming.
Many {user type} struggle to {achieve goal}.
Navigating the {industry} space isn't always straightforward.
Access to quality {resource} has traditionally been {difficult/expensive}.
closings: Results depend on individual effort and market conditions.
Outcomes vary based on how you apply what's offered.
What you get out depends on what you put in.
Individual experiences will differ.

templates.name: story_lead
templates.description: Opens with a relatable narrative or scenario
templates.skeleton:
[Relatable scenario for target user]. [Common experience or frustration].

[Product name] [was created/exists] to [address this]. [Key differentiator]. [What members get access to].

[Invitation to explore]. [Note about options/tiers].
openers: Picture this: you're {common scenario}.
You've been {common struggle}. Sound familiar?
Most {user type} start out {common starting point}.
If you've ever felt {common frustration}, you're not alone.
The journey to {goal} often starts with {common experience}.
closings: See what tier fits your goals.
Check out the available options.
Take a look and decide what works.
Explore what's on offer.

templates.name: outcome_focused
templates.description: Leads with the end result users want to achieve
templates.skeleton:
[Desired outcome statement]. [Product name] [is built around/focuses on] helping you [achieve this].

[Method/approach used]. [Key features that enable the outcome]. [What sets it apart].

[Realistic expectation setting]. [Invitation to learn more].
openers: Better {outcomes} start with better {inputs}.
Improving your {metric} is the goal here.
The aim is simple: help you {achieve X}.
This is about getting you closer to {goal}.
Building {skill/portfolio/results} takes the right support.
closings: Results vary—explore and see if it fits.
Not everyone gets the same results, but the tools are there.
What you achieve depends on multiple factors.
Take a look and assess for yourself.

templates.name: feature_breakdown
templates.description: Systematically presents key features and their benefits
templates.skeleton:
[Product name] [offers/includes/provides] [broad category of value].

[Feature 1] [gives you/enables/provides] [benefit]. [Feature 2] [helps with/supports] [use case]. [Feature 3] [is designed for] [specific need].

[Who it's suited for]. [How to get started].
openers: Here's what {product} brings to the table.
{Product} combines several tools in one place.
This platform packs {feature category} into a single subscription.
Access to {feature type} is the core offering.
The package includes {overview of features}.
closings: Compare the tiers to find what suits you.
Review the options and pick your level.
Check the features against your needs.
See which plan aligns with your goals.

templates.name: community_angle
templates.description: Emphasizes the community and peer support aspects
templates.skeleton:
[Product name] [connects you with/gives access to] a [community description].

[What community offers]. [Types of members]. [Interaction opportunities]. [Support available].

[Who benefits most]. [How to join].
openers: Join a group of {user type} working toward similar goals.
Connect with others who are {pursuing similar outcomes}.
This isn't just a product—it's a community.
Surround yourself with {type of people}.
Learning alongside peers makes a difference.
closings: See if the community fits what you're looking for.
Check out who else is involved.
Take a look at the member benefits.
Explore the community aspects.

templates.name: transparency_focus
templates.description: Emphasizes clear terms, honest expectations, no surprises
templates.skeleton:
[Transparency statement about the product]. [What you get is clearly defined].

[Specific inclusions]. [What's NOT included or promised]. [How pricing works].

[Honest assessment of who it's for]. [Encouragement to review details].
openers: Here's exactly what you're getting.
No hidden terms—this is what's included.
Transparency matters. Here's the breakdown.
What you see is what you get.
Let's be clear about what this offers.
closings: Review the full details before deciding.
Read through the terms so there are no surprises.
Make sure it aligns with your expectations.
Check everything before you commit.

templates.name: empowerment_tone
templates.description: Focuses on user agency and taking control
templates.skeleton:
[Empowerment statement]. [Product name] [puts you in control of/equips you with] [capability].

[Tools available]. [How they support independence]. [What you can do with them].

[Encouragement to take action]. [Note about personal responsibility].
openers: Take control of your {area}.
Your {outcomes} are in your hands.
Empower yourself with the right tools.
Stop relying on {old method}—build your own {capability}.
It's time to own your {journey/results}.
closings: The tools are here—what you do with them is up to you.
Take the first step when you're ready.
Start when it makes sense for you.
The opportunity is there if you want it.

templates.name: discovery_based
templates.description: Invites exploration and discovery of the platform
templates.skeleton:
[Invitation to discover/explore]. [Product name] [offers/contains] [areas to explore].

[First discovery point]. [Second discovery point]. [Third discovery point]. [How they connect].

[Encouragement to browse]. [Low-pressure closing].
openers: Discover what {product} has to offer.
There's a lot to explore here.
See what's available inside {product}.
Browse through the features and resources.
Take your time exploring what's included.
closings: Browse around and see what catches your interest.
No rush—explore at your own pace.
Take a look when you have time.
See if anything resonates with your goals.

templates.name: skeptic_conversion
templates.description: Addresses common doubts and builds trust
templates.skeleton:
[Acknowledgment of common skepticism]. [Validation that caution is reasonable].

[How this product addresses concerns]. [Evidence or differentiators]. [What makes it worth considering].

[Suggestion to verify independently]. [No-pressure approach].
openers: If you've been burned before, you're right to be cautious.
Skeptical? That's understandable.
Not sure if this is legit? Fair question.
You've probably seen promises that didn't pan out.
It's smart to question what's being offered.
closings: Do your own research and decide.
Check it out skeptically—that's fine.
Verify what matters to you before committing.
Take your time making a decision.

templates.name: scenario_based
templates.description: Presents different user scenarios and how the product fits
templates.skeleton:
[Product name] [works for different situations]. [General applicability statement].

[Scenario 1]: [how product helps]. [Scenario 2]: [how product helps]. [Scenario 3]: [how product helps].

[Invitation to identify your scenario]. [Flexibility note].
openers: Whether you're {scenario A} or {scenario B}, there's something here.
Different goals, different needs—same platform.
This works for {type 1}, {type 2}, and {type 3}.
No matter where you're starting from...
From {beginner scenario} to {advanced scenario}...
closings: Find which scenario matches yours.
See where you fit in.
Pick the path that makes sense for you.
Identify your starting point and go from there.

templates.name: short_punchy
templates.description: Brief, direct, action-oriented with minimal fluff
templates.skeleton:
[Direct statement about product]. [One-line value prop].

[Feature 1]. [Feature 2]. [Feature 3].

[Quick CTA]. [Brief qualifier].
openers: {Product}: {one-line description}.
Get {benefit} with {product}.
{Product} = {core offering}.
Here's the deal: {concise value prop}.
Simple: {what it does}.
closings: Check it out.
See the options.
Take a look.
Explore.
